business.headline: 63% of households aware, yet only 9.5% invest in markets, Sebi survey showsDespite growing awareness about investing in the markets, the latest Sebi survey shows that only a small fraction of households, i.e., just 9.5%, are actively investing.

Looking for high returns? This small savings scheme beats PPF and NSCMany investors assume PPF or NSC offer the best returns, but the scheme leads the pack with the highest interest among small savings schemes. Have a look.

Wintrack vs Chennai Customs: Do companies have law on their side if forced to bribe?The Finance Ministry has already ordered an official probe, but the matter has also raised a wider debate: if businesses are forced to pay bribes to get their consignments cleared, do they have the law on their side?

Will Zerodha end its zero-brokerage model for equity delivery trades?Zerodha, long known for offering free equity delivery trades, could soon charge for delivery trades for the first time, signalling a major shift for investors.

India can't be passive spectator: Nirmala Sitharaman talks tough amid US tariffsUnion Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman opened the Kautilya Economic Conclave 2025 in New Delhi, urging India to play a more active role in shaping global decisions amid growing economic and geopolitical uncertainty.

Wintrack's explosive charge opens Customs 'can of worms'After the Finance Ministry confirmed an official probe into Wintrack's charges, importers, customs brokers, and business owners across the country have started sharing their own accounts of harassment, bribery demands.
Sensex opens 205 points lower, Nifty below 24,800; Tata Steel up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 208.31 points to 80,775.00, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 75 points to 24,760.80 as of 9:30 am.

WeWork India IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check GMPFounded in 2016, WeWork India is a flexible workspace operator offering a wide range of solutions including co-working spaces, managed offices, enterprise office suites, private offices, and hybrid digital solutions.

OpenAI hits $500 billion mark as SoftBank, others buy shares: ReportThe latest valuation marks a sharp rise from the company's previous valuation of $300 billion and highlights how quickly OpenAI's value has grown as demand for artificial intelligence tools continues to rise.

Bribes and social media war: Import firm vs Chennai Customs over 'corruption'The controversy began on the social media platform X where Wintrack Inc, a Chennai-based import company, accused Chennai Customs of systemic corruption, saying that constant demands for bribes had forced it to shut down its operations.

Google layoffs: Over 100 design jobs cut in AI shiftGoogle has also been cutting back on management layers. According to reports, the company has reduced the number of middle managers by more than a third, particularly those overseeing small teams.

Market holiday: Are NSE, BSE open on Gandhi Jayanti, Dussehra on October 2?Sensex and Nifty gained nearly 1% in the last session after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) kept the repo rate unchanged at 5.5% and maintained its neutral stance.

entertainment.headline: Daughter was asked for nudes during video game: Akshay Kumar recalls cyber horror Akshay Kumar has recalled an incident when his daughter was asked to send nude photos while playing video game a few months back. He urged mandatory cyber period in schools at a recent event.

Bhagwat Chapter One trailer: Jitendra Kumar sheds good guy image in crime thriller The trailer of Bhagwat Chapter One Raakshas starring Arshad Warsi and Jitendra Kumar is released ahead of its Zee5 premiere on October 17. The film delves into crime and psychological drama set in Uttar Pradesh, promising a gripping narrative.

The Ba***ds of Bollywood trends globally; Aryan Khan reflects on challenges, joy Aryan Khan's 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' is trending globally. Amid the success, the director reflected on the challenges and joy of shooting the series.

Ram Charan showcases archery skills at Dussehra event, wife shares video Actor Ram Charan threw arrows at Raavan effigies during Dussehra festivities on Thursday. His wife Upasana Konidela posted a video of the event on social media. Have a look.

Cillian Murphy's Peaky Blinders confirmed for two new seasons Cillian Murphy's historical crime drama 'Peaky Blinders' will be back with two new seasons on Netflix, following the franchise film 'The Immortal Man', which is slated to release in 2026.

Sahher Bamba recalls meeting Shah Rukh Khan, praises Gauri Khan Sahher Bamba shares her memorable experience meeting Shah Rukh Khan and Gauri Khan. She highlights the warmth and motherly care shown by Gauri Khan on the sets of 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'.

Neeraj Ghaywan reacts to reports of paying less compensation to Homebound family Director Neeraj Ghaywan reacted to reports of paying less compensation to the family on whom 'Homebound' is based.  The filmmaker set the record straight with his post on social media.

Bigg Boss 19 ep 40: Farrhana vs Ashnoor, housemates compete for captaincy Farrhana Bhatt and Ashnoor Kaur had a huge fight over house duties in the latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19'. Earlier in the day, all the contestants competed against each other to clinch captaincy contendership.

Priyanka Chopra receives cute handmade card for daughter Malti on flight to US. Pics Priyanka Chopra returned to the US after her Mumbai trip and shared a sweet handmade card from Emirates for her daughter, Malti Marie Chopra Jonas.

Taylor Swift's The Life of a Showgirl: Mother has fed us again Taylor Swift's 12th studio album 'The Life of a Showgirl' review: It is fast, fun and fierce, proving once again why she's the ultimate mother of pop music.
Bobby Deol joins Delhi's Ramlila celebration, burns Ravana's effigy on Dussehra Bollywood actor Bobby Deol made Delhi's Ramlila more exciting this Dussehra by burning Ravana's effigy at the Red Fort.

The Smashing Machine review: Dwayne Johnson shines in gritty biopicRelease Date:Fri Oct 03, 2025 The Smashing Machine movie review: Dwayne Johnson's 'The Smashing Machine' offers a gritty portrayal of MMA legend Mark Kerr's turbulent career. It reveals the human cost behind the fighter's public glory and personal struggles.

Sharvari begins shooting for Imtiaz Ali's next, wishes Dussehra with special note Bollywood actor Sharvari has begun shooting her next film with acclaimed director Imtiaz Ali, co-starring Vedang Raina, marking the start of the project on Dussehra with a special puja.

Taylor Swift releases new album The Life of a Showgirl, Spotify crashes Spotify experienced a surge in user activity following Taylor Swift's 'The Life of a Showgirl' album release, leading to app crashes. Over 1,000 users reported issues, highlighting the significant demand for the pop star's latest work.

Cinematic thunderstorm: Prabhas, Sandeep Vanga shower praise on Kantara Chapter 1 Actor Prabhas and director Sandeep Reddy Vanga were blown away by Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1'. While Prabhas called the film brilliant, Sandeep praised the film as a cinematic thunderstorm.

Pawan Kalyan announces plans for OG prequel and sequel after film's success Pawan Kalyan formally announced the plans for a sequel and prequel to 'They Call Him OG' at the film's success meet. The film's strong box office performance motivates continued work on the 'OG' franchise.

Sunny Sanskari box office Day 1: How much did Varun-Janhvi film make? Read here 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' starring Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor opened to Rs 9.25 crore on its first day amid stiff competition from 'Kantara Chapter 1'.

Rani Mukerji says her mother asked producer to drop her from debut: Don't take her Rani Mukerji reflected on her early struggles in joining films, sharing how her father was against her acting career and her mother even doubted her first screen test. Now a National Award winner, she believes acting has become a far more feasible and respected career option for today's youngsters.

Rishab Shetty recalls inspiring journey: 1 show in 2016 to 5,000 Kantara shows Rishab Shetty recalled his inspiring journey from a struggling director to one of Kannada cinema's celebrated actor-directors. His film 'Kantara: Chapter 1' has achieved over 5,000 houseful shows, marking a major milestone in his career.

general news.headline: Stop state-sponsored terror if you want place in geography, Army chief warns PakIndian armed forces carried out Operation Sindoor strikes on May 7, destroying Pakistani terror network and killing over 100 terrorists in response to the Pahalgam terror attack.

Pakistan Army is a mercenary force, once butchered 25,000 PalestiniansFrom the 1970 Black September in Jordan when Pakistani troops under Zia-Ul-Haq's command butchered 25,000 Palestinians, to the brand-new defence pact with Riyadh, Pakistan's generals have long fought for whoever signs the biggest cheques. The latest deal with Saudi Arabia, with a promise of a nuclear shield, is the latest chapter in Rawalpindi's long mercenary ledger.

Mahindra's iconic off-roader gets better: Here's what's newMahindra has launched the new Thar facelift in India, starting at Rs 9.99 lah (ex-showroom), featuring refreshed styling, upgraded interiors, advanced tech, and enhanced off-road capability while retaining its rugged lifestyle SUV appeal.
Learn How Adobe Express Is Making Graphic Design Fun In ClassroomsThe Adobe Express app is available on any smart device or desktop computer.

No contamination found: Drugs regulator sources on cough syrup-linked deathsWhile two children have died in Rajasthan, nine have died of kidney failure allegedly after consuming the cough syrup in Madhya Pradesh.

Apple Watch Ultra saves life of 26-year-old Mumbai techie after scuba diving accidentThe robust health and environment tracking in devices like Apple Watch can prove to be life-saving. As the Apple Watch Ultra recently did in the case of Kshitij Zodape, a Mumbai resident who was scuba diving in Puducherry a few months ago.

In Balochistan, where Dussehra was once homeDussehra in Balochistan (A province in Pakistan) – this may seem unreal now, but in the 1920s, during colonial rule, the region witnessed the burning of Ravana's effigies year after year. The popular festival brought the Hindu community together in a spirit of cohesiveness. It wasn't just Balochistan. Records show that Dussehra was celebrated widely in other parts of present-day Pakistan too. From Lahore to Sindh, the festival was popular and vibrant. Let's take a dive into this once-popular tradition in the history of Balochistan.

Not ours: Pakistan Foreign Minister distances from Trump's 20-point Gaza planDuring a TV interview earlier this week, the Foreign Minister had stressed that the plan was a US initiative and not drafted by Pakistan. "This is not our document. There are some key areas we want addressed and if they are not, we will ensure they are," he had said.

Sarah Mullally named first female Archbishop of CanterburyThe Church of England is set to announce a new Archbishop of Canterbury, with frontrunners including female bishops Guli Francis-Dehqani and Rachel Treweek, marking a possible historic first. The new leader will face challenges of abuse scandals, declining attendance, and divisions over women and LGBTQ issues.

TCS to cut 12,000 jobs, some staff offered 2-year severance pay: ReportTata Consultancy Services (TCS) has begun reducing its workforce, offering severance packages of up to two years' salary to employees whose skills no longer match the company's evolving business needs. Here are the details.

iPhone Air review: Love and limitationsOf the three iPhones this year, the iPhone Air is the one that is likely to evoke strongest feelings — either you will love it, or you won't at all. And your response to it is going to reveal as much about you as it does about the phone. That, according to this iPhone Air review, is a win for Apple.

Mumbai civic body deletes tweet after Internet points out shoddy road repair workThe now-deleted tweet by BMC, which included photos of the repair on the road in Mumbai's Kunchi Korve Nagar, was meant to highlight the completion of maintenance but instead drew sharp criticism for the poor quality of work.

Office empty after 5 pm, Indian CA in Europe shares viral 'corporate shock' videoIndian Chartered Accountant Jyoti Saini's video of her empty European office has gone viral. The clip has led to discussions comparing Western and Indian work ethics and office timings.

Weight-loss injections can't fix your body-image issuesWeight-loss injections aren't a magic solution for body image issues, they can sometimes make things worse. Focus on realistic health goals instead of obsessing over how you look.

OPT in danger? New US bill could tax foreign students' wagesA bill to tax OPT participants and employers is adding to the US visa policy fears. The changes threaten Indian students' earnings, tie into H-1B upheaval, and raise fears about the post-study path.

One can say I love Modi, not I love Muhammad: Owaisi fumes amid Bareilly unrestSpeaking in Hyderabad, Owaisi condemned police actions in Bareilly, questioned minority rights, and urged people to act within the law amid rising tensions.

Pak's Sana Mir calls PoK player Azad Kashmir's, clarifies after massive backlashPakistani commentator Sana Mir has clarified her usage of the phrase "Azad Kashmir" while referring to a cricketer from Pakistan-occupied Kashmir during a Women's World Cup match.

sports.headline: Playing into hands of India: West Indies slammed for delaying 2nd new ball West Indies' decision to delay the use of the second new ball was slammed by Abhishek Nayar, Aakash Chopra and Daren Ganga, who questioned the mentality of the visitors during the Ahmedabad Test.

West Indies greats list reform roadmap after 27 all out humiliation vs Australia Cricket West Indies (CWI) announced immediate and long-term structural measures to address on-field struggles and revive cricket development across the Caribbean, following input from legendary figures and current stakeholders.

Premier League to take a call on divisive profit and sustainability rules The Premier League is preparing for a critical decision on its Profit and Sustainability Rules (PSR), with discussions underway about adopting a new financial model. This could significantly alter club spending regulations.

Cameron Green ready to resume bowling ahead of Ashes series Australia all-rounder Cameron Green is set to resume bowling following spinal surgery, with a carefully managed plan designed to ensure he peaks in time for the Ashes.

AB de Villiers divides opinions after questioning India over Asia Cup trophy row Former cricketer AB de Villiers comments on the Asia Cup trophy presentation sparked backlash from Indian fans. India refused to recieve the trophy from Asian and Pakistan cricket chief, Mohsin Naqvi, after outclassing Pakistan in the final in Dubai on Friday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
